thread.title: 'Frightening 5K Glow Run' brings scary runners to city
thread.title_full: 'Frightening 5K Glow Run' brings scary runners to city

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: 'Frightening 5K Glow Run' brings scary runners to city
text:
'Frightening 5K Glow Run' brings scary runners to city Winchenbach, Daggett fastest; Winchenbach, Leach, Leonard best dressed By Staff | Oct 20, 2015 Rockland — Runners and walkers were put in scary situations — or, more accurately, they put those watching in scary situations — during the "Frightening 5K Glow Run" on Saturday, Oct. 17 at the Mid-Coast School of Technology. 
The run included a costume contest for participants, with awards for the best costumes. The winners, in order, were Darren Winchenbach as Gene Simmons from KISS, Patricia Leach as Eliot from E.T. and Alison Leonard as Wonder Woman. 
In the race/walk, Winchenbach finished first in 18 minutes and 32 seconds, while Katie Daggett was the first female to cross the 3.1-mile course, fifth overall, in 23:05. The glow run/walk set off from the vocational school campus at 5:30 p.m. Proceeds benefit the MCST's SkillsUSA student organization. SkillsUSA is an organization that works to improve the quality of America’s skilled workforce and provide skills to the future workforce and citizens of each state. Each year, MCST sends students to competitions which reward top students in each skill category with continuing education opportunities. 
The individual 5K run/walk results were: 1, Winchenbach, 18:32; 2, Cameron Leach, 19:38; 3, Tim Thompson, 20:54; 4, Lucas McNelly, 21:39; 5, Daggett, 23:05; 6, Patricia Leach, 23:15; 7, Rusty Nickerson, 23:56; 8, Kristy Hastings, 24:37; 9, Aubrey Schaeffer, 26:39; 10, Cassie Smeltzer, 26:40; 11, Carroll Pelletier, 27:11; 12, Christina Strong, 28:15; 13, Rachelle Haynes, 28:16; 14, Karen Cassette, 28:21; 15, Emma Hooper, 28:24; 16, Kerry Bridges, 29:30; 17, Linda Thompson, 29:47; 18, Beth Feraco, 30:38; 19, Leonard, 30:39; 20, Ellen Spring, 31:38; 21, Brianne Luce, 31:46; 22, Jordan Luce-Warren, 31:47; 23, Trina Johnson, 32:34; 24, Christine Mercier, 35:29; 25, Gary Mercier, 35:30; 26, Kaysee Leary, 37:25; 27, Dan Schaeffer, 46:32; 28, Judy Harrington, 47:59; 29, Eilee Stelzer, 50:17; 30, Emylee Leary, 50:18; 31, Alexys Schaeffer, 52:54; and 32, Gina Schaeffer, 54:55.
